p: Epidemiology reports show fluctuating typical and atypical symptoms from one epidemic to another, possibly due to: i) specific environment, ii) the genetic and immunological makeup of the infected population, iii) the viral strain and iv) the specific applied epidemiological models. This clinical heterogeneity reported across epidemiological and clinical studies of CHIKV outbreaks highlights the need for and importance of a rigorous clinical profile of the CHIKV infection in humans.[ 8, 23, 24]
